Description: Ostracon, large section of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery vessel: the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit overlaid with an off-white granular deposit; the exterior, the lower section of which is grooved, is covered with a brown slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394820) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394820)
